docs.snippet: Oscar De La Hoya led the way, and Julio Cesar Chavez followed with a fight that lasted only six seconds longer. Now they get each other in what may be the  most anticipated non-heavyweight fight in nearly a decade.         De La Hoya and Chavez bo...
docs.lead_paragraph: Oscar De La Hoya led the way, and Julio Cesar Chavez followed with a fight that lasted only six seconds longer. Now they get each other in what may be the most anticipated non-heavyweight fight in nearly a decade. De La Hoya and Chavez both scored second-round knockouts tonight in tuneup bouts against outclassed opponents, setting up a June 7 bout that will pay each fighter more than $9 million.

headline.main: De La Hoya and Chavez Pave the Way to a Payday

docs.snippet: One man was killed and two others were injured when the snow-laden roof of a  recycling plant crashed down on them this morning, six weeks after a truck had hit a major support beam in the center of the building, the Suffolk County police said.   ...
docs.lead_paragraph: One man was killed and two others were injured when the snow-laden roof of a recycling plant crashed down on them this morning, six weeks after a truck had hit a major support beam in the center of the building, the Suffolk County police said. "I heard this crack and suddenly, I was swimming in a pile of ice and broken glass," said one of the injured men, Jose Alvarez.

headline.main: Roof Collapses at L.I. Plant, Killing Worker

docs.snippet: Sometimes, the game is about more than money. Corny, maybe, but often it's about love.         For Oscar De La Hoya, the glib golden boy of boxing, tonight's fracas against Darryl Tyson in Las Vegas, Nev., could be a barometer of how the people in...
docs.lead_paragraph: Sometimes, the game is about more than money. Corny, maybe, but often it's about love. For Oscar De La Hoya, the glib golden boy of boxing, tonight's fracas against Darryl Tyson in Las Vegas, Nev., could be a barometer of how the people in the old neighborhood accept him.

headline.main: De La Hoya Longs for Macho-Man Image

docs.snippet: The United States Davis Cup team has reconvened for the weekend without Andre Agassi, who held the No. 1 spot that has been bequeathed to Michael Chang.         Chang, who has been a stranger to the Davis Cup since 1990, was often heckled about it...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Davis Cup team has reconvened for the weekend without Andre Agassi, who held the No. 1 spot that has been bequeathed to Michael Chang. Chang, who has been a stranger to the Davis Cup since 1990, was often heckled about it by Agassi, but he is here to face Mexico.

docs.snippet: Preparing the journal for the 15th annual awards gala of the Council of Fashion Designers of America, to be held on Monday at Lincoln Center, Fern Mallis, the council's executive director, was hard pressed to find photographs of designers from 198...
docs.lead_paragraph: Preparing the journal for the 15th annual awards gala of the Council of Fashion Designers of America, to be held on Monday at Lincoln Center, Fern Mallis, the council's executive director, was hard pressed to find photographs of designers from 1980's awards shows. Instead, she found scads of pictures of socialites. Photographs today would tell a different story. In the last five years, the council has transformed itself from a klatch of 1980's nouvelle society into a formidable trade group that has, through its unified shows and charitable events, helped to push American fashion to the fore.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: COUNCIL OF FASHION DESIGNERS OF AMERICA

headline.main: When Theater Turns Out to Be Just a Stage

docs.lead_paragraph: WE KIND OF LIKED 'The Godfather' and those Scorsese movies, and we started out trying to do kind of a gritty movie," explained Owen C. Wilson of the script that five years later became the movie "Bottle Rocket." Then reality bit.

headline.main: Their Feet in Texas, Their Heads in the Clouds

docs.snippet: The drug trafficking suspect Juan Garcia Abrego and his men became so brazen, and the citizenry so terrorized, during a decade of bloodshed in this border town that a gunman said to be working for him once shot a municipal policeman dead on a down...
docs.lead_paragraph: The drug trafficking suspect Juan Garcia Abrego and his men became so brazen, and the citizenry so terrorized, during a decade of bloodshed in this border town that a gunman said to be working for him once shot a municipal policeman dead on a downtown street for giving the gunman a parking ticket and local newspapers largely ignored the crime. When a young reporter, Oscar Trevino Jr., revisited the murder in a year-in-review piece months later, his publisher ordered the story killed. And when the article made its way into print anyway because of a newsroom mix-up, the publisher called Mr. Trevino to a restaurant to apologize to Mr. Garcia Abrego personally.

headline.main: Mexican Drug Gang's Reign of Blood

docs.snippet: THERMAL inversion is the name of the wintertime weather event that turns the  air over Mexico City into a grayish-yellow pudding of pollutants. Cold air that  sinks at night becomes trapped during the day in the bowl formed by the splendid volcano...
docs.lead_paragraph: THERMAL inversion is the name of the wintertime weather event that turns the air over Mexico City into a grayish-yellow pudding of pollutants. Cold air that sinks at night becomes trapped during the day in the bowl formed by the splendid volcanoes and mountains surrounding the city. The poisons spewed out by 2.5 million cars, 360 fume-filled gas stations and thousands of dirty industries are immobilized for city residents to inhale deeply for hours on end. A succession of unyielding thermal inversions made January especially asphyxiating. At mid-month officials declared a three-day air pollution emergency, barring half the cars in the city from driving one weekend and ordering industries to cut production 40 per cent.

headline.main: THE WORLD: Mexico's Political Inversion;The City That Can't Fix the Air
